title: Hey Riot,
body:
Is it possible to get one of my accounts unbanned? Lmao

The account owned everything prior to Ziggs, as it was banned a day after Ziggs' released 2/2/2012, I was banned for extreme toxicity, even after being promised an unban, the unban was refused when I did what was asked. To be fair the account sat in the top ten in the ladder, lmao D:

http://i.gyazo.com/f28493154476c673e375df08665375ae.png

Back Riot when Riot actually listened, I learned the guy that said i could be unbanned left Riot before I completed his challenge, ans folks, is what drove me to being an arse to everyone. RIP.

P.S: This was my very first account that I reached to thirty, it was made in the beta along with my second account, both my accounts are perm banned, both owned everything in the store, I'm still angry my appeal was denied, so glad the rioter who denied it was fired, get rekt

Assuming Bipolar isn't lying I think Riot should at least follow through with their promise, even if the employee who promised it quit/was fired. For all we know Bipolar could change their attitude if they are given their original account back in order to keep it, if not it's not like it will make the situation any worse.

Ok so lets assume this is legit.

has he reformed since this time?
the rioter was looking for change, was looking for hope.

there was none.
this person hasn't reformed, hasn't changed.

and if he had, he wouldn't have multiple accounts banned.

this statement says it all really, hes reckless and cares about no-one but himself.

Being nice isn't a chore, its something that is actually quite easy, and get easier the more you do it, again what the rioter was trying to achieve.


he failed, and on top of this i wont be surprised if hes banned again soon.


#DOESNTDESERVESH!T

Assuming he's not lying, his behaviour does stem from the broken promise of the removal of the perma-ban from his original account. While it was ultimately his decision that decision was made in circumstances created by Riot not fulfilling a promise. At the very least Riot could come through on that promise, see if it makes a difference and, if t doesn't, just perma-ban the account again. Like I said, it wont make the situation any worse.

His behaviour doesnt stem from it, if it did he would not of been banned in the first place.

Here is what will happen, if you un-ban that account.. more smurfs will be made, and they will be used to "vent" instead and the account.
Not sure what to feel about this one considering you said somewhere else that you currently have 13 perm banned acc under your belts, so yer.

Look it's not that I like to swear at people it's something I cannot help, it's the same reason why I don't do face-to-face talking, I get nervous and I begin to swear and most people are distressed by it. I grew up with the words, they're apart of my vocabulary and it will never change. I've played League since the very beginning, I was lucky accepted into the beta (so not the real beginning but still) when portraits were hand drawn and not done by PC, when it was large triangle feet instead of big breasts. I remember having 15+ Rioters added at one time.

When you don't have nothing to fight for, you don't fight, when my appeal was denied (when it should have been accepted) I stopped caring, I say whats on my mind, that is my issue, it's both a gift and a curse.

> [{quoted}](name=Bipolar,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=pf83kFNF,comment-id=0002000000000000,timestamp=2015-06-04T12:49:52.167+0000)

I would never say it's a gift, also riot doesn't care that you had 15+ employees added on your friends list. They cut their ties and became game overlords (more benevolent then 99.99999999% of every other gaming company) probably around 2011/2012 when I started playing. Another thing, no one is going to give you inspiration to care but you, you can get mad at riot for taking it away but you only have yourself to blame for losing it forever.

> [{quoted}](name=Chicken4dinner,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=pf83kFNF,comment-id=00020000000000000000,timestamp=2015-06-04T14:43:35.758+0000)

Being able to speak your mind without thinking can be a gift, in that aspect I don't fear people. I know Riot don't care, I simply said it because I played with them regularly and it was a fond memory.

I accept I got banned, I deserved it, I didn't deserve being lied told and given false hope in hope that I would get my account back.

For some reason I decided to come back to this post. If it was such a fond memory then honour it, I accept that you didn't deserve to be given a false hope but you also don't deserve to crap on your own reputation like this... Why let someone else's failures hold **YOU** back?

Have a think on what I said if you ever come back

Oh wow, one of the Unban Challenges.
Real old stuff. Haven't seen one in ages.

History aside, TLDR is that the idea was discontinued after they basically found out it didn't work. For the very few who completed the "challenge", there were hundreds who ended up making everyone's life hellish, so now permabans just mean "get out and don't come back".

I guess you were caught in the middle? Or you just didn't pass.
That Rioter changing job wouldn't affect it. The ticket would have just been passed on to someone else.
